column4: I was wondering, if I installed the x86 edition, yet have a 64 bit processor (dual core), the system is not making full use of the resources available, correct? I know I could change my kernel, but would changing my kernel to reflect this remove my ability to run 32 bit software?
you would need to reinstall with a full ubuntu 64bit system
you are not losing much in your current state, and it probably isn't worth the bother
so there is no way to take advantage of anything without reinstalling... ohh ok then, no worries
